name: Fluvoxamine

dosing.adult_acute: 50 mg at bedtime, increase by 50 mg every 4-7 days
dosing.notes: Divide doses >100 mg/day (BID); CR formulation allows once-daily dosing; take at bedtime to minimize daytime sedation

canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: Increase by 50 mg every 4-7 days; divide BID when >100 mg/day
canadian_clinical.max_dose_practice: 300 mg/day; rarely used at max dose due to sedation and GI effects
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: Start 50 mg qHS; increase to 150-200 mg within 2 weeks as tolerated
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: Start 50 mg qHS; slow titration; monitor for sedation and nausea

warnings: Black box warning: Increased suicidal thinking in children/adolescents/young adults
Strong CYP1A2 and CYP2C19 inhibitor - MULTIPLE significant drug interactions (clozapine, olanzapine, theophylline, warfarin)
More sedating than other SSRIs - bedtime dosing preferred
Higher GI side effects (nausea) than other SSRIs
Less commonly prescribed due to drug interactions and side effect profile

cautions.hepatic: Start with lower dose, titrate slowly in hepatic impairment
cautions.pregnancy: Pregnancy Category C; limited data available
